Santa Rosa Beach, FL 32459

850-278-6440

Open 7 days a week!
Weekdays: 11 am  —  9 pm
Fri & Sat: 11 am — 10 pm
Live Music + Events

The Story
Brian and Brittney Kelley had their eye on the property at 4234 West County Highway 30A. They loved its cabin vibe, and all of the citrus and magnolia trees growing around it. Rosemary was growing in the backyard. They knew it was a gorgeous, special place when they bought it. The couple played around with many ideas for what to do with the space, until they landed on a great burger joint – a place for a delicious and quick bite, even later at night, when many restaurants at the beach have closed. Brian had always wanted to do something with the name “Papa Surf”: and suddenly it all clicked.
Restoring old properties has always been important to the Kelleys, who live part-time at 30A and also own the local clothing store Tribe Kelley. For them, it was important to make the old new, to restore and reinforce the building’s incredible character but make it stronger than ever before.
The Story
Brian and Brittney Kelley had their eye on the property at 4234 West County Highway 30A. They loved its cabin vibe, and all of the citrus and magnolia trees growing around it. Rosemary was growing in the backyard. They knew it was a gorgeous, special place when they bought it. The couple played around with many ideas for what to do with the space, until they landed on a great burger joint – a place for a delicious and quick bite, even later at night, when many restaurants at the beach have closed. Brian had always wanted to do something with the name “Papa Surf”: and suddenly it all clicked.
Restoring old properties has always been important to the Kelleys, who live part-time at 30A and also own the local clothing store Tribe Kelley. For them, it was important to make the old new, to restore and reinforce the building’s incredible character but make it stronger than ever before.
About
2024 30A “Hot Spot” Award - “Best Burger”
We are proud to announce that Papa Surf Burger Bar has been selected as the winner of the "Burgers" category in the prestigious "2024 Hot Spot" awards, as voted by 30A locals! This recognition reaffirms our commitment to excellence in serving delicious burgers that delight our customers' taste buds. We graciously accept this award and extend our heartfelt thanks to our loyal patrons who continue to inspire us to craft the best possible experiences at Papa Surf.
Where Music and Sports Meet Delicious Burgers
Papa Surf was the the brainchild of power couple and 30A locals, Brian and Brittney Kelley. The Kelleys partnered with country musician Jason Aldean and his wife, Brittany, along with hall of fame baseball player Tom Glavine and his wife, Chris. Combining the three families’ shared love for music, sports, and mouthwatering burgers, they embarked on an exciting venture that would bring joy to burger enthusiasts and fans alike.
Brian Kelley, known as one-half of the acclaimed country duo Florida Georgia Line, has always had a passion for great food. Jason Aldean, a multi-platinum selling artist, shares the Kelleys' love for flavorful cuisine. Tom Glavine, a legendary pitcher and a household name in baseball, brings his competitive spirit and dedication to excellence to the mix.
Papa Surf aims to capture the essence of their collective passions within its vibrant and welcoming space. The founders envisioned a place where folks can come together to enjoy delicious burgers, good company, and a lively atmosphere. The name "Papa Surf" pays homage to their shared love for the beach, a place that offers an escape from the demands of their respective careers.

Meet Delicious Burgers

The Founders
The Founders
The Founders
Jason + Brittany Aldean
Country music star Jason Aldean has 27 #1 songs including “She’s Country”, “The Truth”, “Dirt Road Anthem”, “Fly Over States” and “Burnin’ it Down”. The Grammy-nominated Macon, Georgia, native has released 10 albums on Nashville’s Broken Bow Records and has countless ACM, Billboard and CMA Awards, including CMA Entertainer of the Year.
Brian + Brittney Kelley
Brian Kelley is a country musician known for his role in the award-winning country music duo Florida Georgia Line and now in his career as a solo artist. Brittney Kelley, his wife and partner, is an accomplished entrepreneur who founded the USA-made brand, Tribe Kelley, offering sustainable and ethically produced clothing. The couple transformed an old historic home in Grayton Beach, FL, into Tribe Kelley Surf Post, their own beach boutique. Together, Brian and Brittney have created a powerful artistic and entrepreneurial partnership, inspiring fans with their talents and commitment to making a positive impact on society. Their love for music, fashion, food, and philanthropy has made them a dynamic force in these industries.
Tom + Chris Glavine
Major League Baseball pitcher Tom Glavine is an Atlanta Braves legend, and was the 1995 World Series MVP, helping the Braves defeat the Cleveland Indians. He made 10 All-Star game appearances, is a four-time Silver Slugger and two-time Cy Young Award winner. Tom ended his career with over 300 wins, and was inducted to the Baseball Hall of Fame in 2014. The lefty’s No. 47 jersey has been retired by the Braves.
The Legend of Papa Surf
On the coast of Florida along Highway 30A, there lived a legendary figure known as Papa Surf. Papa Surf possessed an enduring spirit and a zest for life. With a magnificent white beard, silver-streaked hair, and a shark tooth bolo, he was an unmistakable sight.
Every day, Papa Surf would rise with the sun and head straight to the beach, his loyal surfboard tucked under his arm. The crashing waves and salty breeze fueled his soul, and he reveled in the exhilaration of riding the waves like a young man. His skill and passion for surfing were unmatched, earning him admiration from both locals and visitors alike.
But Papa Surf was more than just a wave-riding enthusiast. He had turned his love for the sea into a thriving business. Just a stone's throw from the beach, Papa Surf owned a burger shop called, unsurprisingly, Papa Surf. With its vibrant surf-themed décor and relaxed atmosphere, the place had become a beloved hangout for beachgoers and surf enthusiasts.
Papa Surf would spend his afternoons greeting customers with a warm smile and a friendly wave. His infectious laughter and colorful stories about his surfing adventures captivated the patrons, transporting them to the magical world of the ocean. His burgers, adorned with southern-inspired toppings and served on toasted buns, were legendary in their own right. Each bite was an explosion of flavors that transported customers to a paradise of culinary delights. People from far and wide flocked to Papa Surf to savor his culinary creations and bask in the aura of this unique Floridian character.
Papa Surf's days were filled with laughter, the sound of crashing waves, and the sizzle of burgers on the grill. Papa Surf’s presence brought joy and inspiration to the community, reminding them that age was just a number and that life's adventures could be embraced at any stage. Papa Surf taught them that following one's passion was the key to a life well-lived and that the ocean held boundless treasures for those who sought them.
And so, Papa Surf continued to ride the waves, bask in the warmth of the Florida sun, and create delicious memories at Papa Surf, his burger shop by the sea. Today, he remains a beloved figure on Highway 30A, embodying the spirit of adventure and reminding everyone that the soul could forever be young, just like the eternal rhythm of the sea.

The Menu
The menu at Papa Surf reflects the commitment to using fresh, high-quality ingredients, ensuring that every burger is a culinary masterpiece. From classic cheeseburgers with a signature twist to inventive combinations featuring locally sourced ingredients, every burger is crafted with care and attention to detail.
Vegetarian options cater to the evolving dietary preferences of their customers, ensuring that everyone can indulge in the Papa Surf experience.

The Vibe
Prepare to be transported to a retro oasis that seamlessly blends nostalgia with contemporary flair. The interior decor, thoughtfully curated by renowned designer Cortney Bishop, is a visual feast that captivates patrons from the moment they enter. Fun fact: Cortney has also designed HOMES FOR THE Kelleys and Aldeans.
One of the standout features of Papa Surf is the custom-built magnolia bar, a true masterpiece. Crafted with meticulous attention to detail, this stunning centerpiece is a celebration of nature and craftsmanship.
The overall ambiance of Papa Surf is one of relaxed enjoyment, where patrons can unwind and soak in the retro-inspired surroundings. The fusion of custom furnishings, fixtures, and carefully curated antiques results in a harmonious blend of comfort and style. Whether seated at the magnolia bar or nestled in a cozy booth, guests are treated to a one-of-a-kind dining experience that transports them to a bygone era, filled with nostalgia and a vibrant spirit.

Meet Delicious Burgers
Papa Surf was the the brainchild of power couple and 30A locals, Brian and Brittney Kelley. The Kelleys partnered with country musician Jason Aldean and his wife, Brittany, along with hall of fame baseball player Tom Glavine and his wife, Chris. Combining the three families’ shared love for music, sports, and mouthwatering burgers, they embarked on an exciting venture that would bring joy to burger enthusiasts and fans alike.
Brian Kelley, known as one-half of the acclaimed country duo Florida Georgia Line, has always had a passion for great food. Jason Aldean, a multi-platinum selling artist, shares the Kelleys' love for flavorful cuisine. Tom Glavine, a legendary pitcher and a household name in baseball, brings his competitive spirit and dedication to excellence to the mix.
Papa Surf aims to capture the essence of their collective passions within its vibrant and welcoming space. The founders envisioned a place where folks can come together to enjoy delicious burgers, good company, and a lively atmosphere. The name "Papa Surf" pays homage to their shared love for the beach, a place that offers an escape from the demands of their respective careers.
The Founders
The Founders
The Founders
Jason + Brittany Aldean
Country music star Jason Aldean has 27 #1 songs including “She’s Country”, “The Truth”, “Dirt Road Anthem”, “Fly Over States” and “Burnin’ it Down”. The Grammy-nominated Macon, Georgia, native has released 10 albums on Nashville’s Broken Bow Records and has countless ACM, Billboard and CMA Awards, including CMA Entertainer of the Year.
Brian + Brittney Kelley
Brian Kelley is a country musician known for his role in the award-winning country music duo Florida Georgia Line and now in his career as a solo artist. Brittney Kelley, his wife and partner, is an accomplished entrepreneur who founded the USA-made brand, Tribe Kelley, offering sustainable and ethically produced clothing. The couple transformed an old historic home in Grayton Beach, FL, into Tribe Kelley Surf Post, their own beach boutique. Together, Brian and Brittney have created a powerful artistic and entrepreneurial partnership, inspiring fans with their talents and commitment to making a positive impact on society. Their love for music, fashion, food, and philanthropy has made them a dynamic force in these industries.
Tom + Chris Glavine
Major League Baseball pitcher Tom Glavine is an Atlanta Braves legend, and was the 1995 World Series MVP, helping the Braves defeat the Cleveland Indians. He made 10 All-Star game appearances, is a four-time Silver Slugger and two-time Cy Young Award winner. Tom ended his career with over 300 wins, and was inducted to the Baseball Hall of Fame in 2014. The lefty’s No. 47 jersey has been retired by the Braves.
The Legend of Papa Surf
On the coast of Florida along Highway 30A, there lived a legendary figure known as Papa Surf. Papa Surf possessed an enduring spirit and a zest for life. With a magnificent white beard, silver-streaked hair, and a shark tooth bolo, he was an unmistakable sight.
Every day, Papa Surf would rise with the sun and head straight to the beach, his loyal surfboard tucked under his arm. The crashing waves and salty breeze fueled his soul, and he reveled in the exhilaration of riding the waves like a young man. His skill and passion for surfing were unmatched, earning him admiration from both locals and visitors alike.
But Papa Surf was more than just a wave-riding enthusiast. He had turned his love for the sea into a thriving business. Just a stone's throw from the beach, Papa Surf owned a burger shop called, unsurprisingly, Papa Surf. With its vibrant surf-themed décor and relaxed atmosphere, the place had become a beloved hangout for beachgoers and surf enthusiasts.
Papa Surf would spend his afternoons greeting customers with a warm smile and a friendly wave. His infectious laughter and colorful stories about his surfing adventures captivated the patrons, transporting them to the magical world of the ocean. His burgers, adorned with southern-inspired toppings and served on toasted buns, were legendary in their own right. Each bite was an explosion of flavors that transported customers to a paradise of culinary delights. People from far and wide flocked to Papa Surf to savor his culinary creations and bask in the aura of this unique Floridian character.
Papa Surf's days were filled with laughter, the sound of crashing waves, and the sizzle of burgers on the grill. Papa Surf’s presence brought joy and inspiration to the community, reminding them that age was just a number and that life's adventures could be embraced at any stage. Papa Surf taught them that following one's passion was the key to a life well-lived and that the ocean held boundless treasures for those who sought them.
And so, Papa Surf continued to ride the waves, bask in the warmth of the Florida sun, and create delicious memories at Papa Surf, his burger shop by the sea. Today, he remains a beloved figure on Highway 30A, embodying the spirit of adventure and reminding everyone that the soul could forever be young, just like the eternal rhythm of the sea.

The Menu
The menu at Papa Surf reflects the commitment to using fresh, high-quality ingredients, ensuring that every burger is a culinary masterpiece. From classic cheeseburgers with a signature twist to inventive combinations featuring locally sourced ingredients, every burger is crafted with care and attention to detail.
Vegetarian options cater to the evolving dietary preferences of their customers, ensuring that everyone can indulge in the Papa Surf experience.

The Vibe
Prepare to be transported to a retro oasis that seamlessly blends nostalgia with contemporary flair. The interior decor, thoughtfully curated by renowned designer Cortney Bishop, is a visual feast that captivates patrons from the moment they enter. Fun fact: Cortney has also designed HOMES FOR THE Kelleys and Aldeans.
One of the standout features of Papa Surf is the custom-built magnolia bar, a true masterpiece. Crafted with meticulous attention to detail, this stunning centerpiece is a celebration of nature and craftsmanship.
The overall ambiance of Papa Surf is one of relaxed enjoyment, where patrons can unwind and soak in the retro-inspired surroundings. The fusion of custom furnishings, fixtures, and carefully curated antiques results in a harmonious blend of comfort and style. Whether seated at the magnolia bar or nestled in a cozy booth, guests are treated to a one-of-a-kind dining experience that transports them to a bygone era, filled with nostalgia and a vibrant spirit.
